comments.body: convention for the name of the first argument of a classmethod is "cls".  If the parameter isn't used at all, make it a @staticmethod instead and remove the parameter altogether.
its used to reference the staticmethod 'prompt' in same class
Ah, I see it now.  yeah, so just change self to be cls to match convention when using `@classmethod` and it should be fine.
Would it be useful to allow `verbose` to accept `stderr` in the function signature too?  We would also have to update `v`, `vv`, etc to support it also.
yep, but thought that would be huge undertaking while this was a 'blanket' requriement

I don't have any experience with the logging code, but setting the level based on color seems a bit error prone. We don't have mechanism for the caller to set the log level rather than having to infer it based on color?
its not great, but that is how our 'error levels' work, and really breaks apart if someone makes them all the same
I wonder if we should `raise AnsibleAssertionError` here then?
Until now log/callback errors have been 'non fatal' , that would be a change in that behaviour
Right, though passing a non-existing color into `display()` would be a programming error, no?

                except KeyError:
                    # this should not happen, but JIC
